thread.title: Walking Dead: Primark forced to can 'offensive' t-shirts from popular zombie show
thread.title_full: Walking Dead: Primark forced to can 'offensive' t-shirts from popular zombie show

title: Walking Dead: Primark forced to can 'offensive' t-shirts from popular zombie show
text:
AMC/GETTY WALKING SHRED: Primark rip up offensive zombie t-shirts 
The t-shirt in question showed the vicious baseball bat of lead villain, Negan, covered in barbed wire. 
But the discount clothes store was inundated with complaints for displaying the catchphrase, "Eeny Meeny Miny Moe". 
TWITTER EENIE MEANY: The t-shirts have been removed from sale “It is directly threatening of a racist assault, and if I were black and were faced by a wearer I would know just where I stood” Ian Lucan 
Methodist minister Ian Lucraft was furious when he spotted the tops on sale in Sheffield, suggesting they could incite racial violence. 
He told the Sheffield Star: “We were shocked when we came face to face with a new t-shirt with a racially explicit graphic and text. 
“It was fantastically offensive and I can only assume that no one in the process of ordering it knew what they were doing or were aware of its subliminal messages. The Walking Dead actors in real life Monday, 10th October 2016 Here's how The Walking Dead's cast looks without the whole zombie apocalypse 1 / 12 AMC * getty Christian Serratos as Rosita 
“The slogan is 'Eeeny meenie miny moe…..' It stops there, but of course we all know what the original said: 'catch a n
